results.title: Subconscious Password
results.creator_credit: Chris Landreth, Mark Smith, Marcy Page, Seneca College Animation Arts Centre, Copperheart Entertainment and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description:
Most of us have had at least one of those excruciating social encounters where you can’t remember someone’s name. Just what is your subconscious up to while you frantically try to recall it?
Cast includes: Don McKellar, Ron Pardo, Patrice Goodman, Ray Landry, Tony Daniels, Athena Karkanis, Nanci Pach, Kedar, Denise Oliver, Dwayne Hill, Chris Landreth and John R. Dilworth.
Music: Daniel Janke
Animation direction and layout: Sean Craig
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris Landreth, Mark Smith, Marcy Page, Seneca College Animation Arts Centre, Copperheart Entertainment and ONF | NFB

results.title: Sub-Igloo [French version]
results.creator_credit: Joseph MacInnis, James de B. Domville, Colin Low and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Film report from a Canadian scientific expedition that put a plastic bubble on the floor of the Arctic Ocean to serve as workshop and rest station for scientists working below the Arctic ice. What it took, in both planning and on-the-spot improvisation, to chop through the heavy ice, and to lower and anchor the huge dome in place in the dark and cold of Resolute Bay, is fully illustrated by film and commentary. French language - no subtitles. (Award: Bordeaux.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joseph MacInnis, James de B. Domville, Colin Low and ONF | NFB
results.description: Film report from a Canadian scientific expedition that put a plastic bubble on the floor of the Arctic Ocean to serve as workshop and rest station for scientists working below the Arctic ice. results.title: Styles of leadership
results.creator_credit: Arthur Swerdloff, Leon S. Gold and Roundtable Productions
results.brief_description: A dramatisation of the acceptance of a contract by a company which will involve it in stepped-up production and extra work, showing four different ways in which executives can lead their staff and ensure their cooperation.

results.title: Styles
results.creator_credit: Gene Feldman and Wombat Productions, Inc.
results.brief_description: Through separate film portraits, depicts the different life styles of three young people, showing the joys, disappointments, decisions and consequences that shape them. Explains that each person has a different choice because of a different inner self. Steve, a school athlete has turned on to drugs; George, a grandson of an immigrant reflects on the satisfaction gained from a simple life; and Laura, a creative person, reveals herself as detached from the crowd.

results.title: Style wars
results.creator_credit: Tony Silver, Henry Chalfant and Public Art Films
results.brief_description: Examines New York’s “hiphop” subculture - the cradle of graffiti, breakdancing and rap music movements which have rocked the international worlds of art and entertainment. Cleverly juxtaposes the viewpoints of the graffiti writers, with those of law enforcement officers and government officials. Mayor Koch advocates five days in jail for repeat “graffiti” offenders and it would appear that there doesn’t seem to be much attempt by those working for the system to understand this sub-culture.

results.title: Style of champions: the Australian crawl
results.creator_credit: Cecil Holmes, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: John Konrads discusses training for championship swimming, particularly the Australian Crawl, showing leading Australian swimmers in action, methods of several coaches and scenes illustrating the popularity of swimming in Australia generally
